intro: Hieracium pallidum subsp. echinanthum, commonly known as the pale hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows and grasslands, preferring well-drained soils. It has hairy stems and leaves, and its flowers are yellow with a central disk. This subspecies is distinguished by its shorter, more compact growth habit compared to other hawkweed species.
